lead_paragraph: A jury awarded $2.7 million in damages on Friday to a woman who said she was dismissed from her job as an insurance claims adjuster after she disclosed that she was pregnant. The woman, Lana Ambruster, 28, said her boss at California Casualty Insurance in San Jose had threatened to dismiss her if she became pregnant. Several former employees testified that he threatened to dismiss anyone who became pregnant because the company had no room in the budget for maternity leave.
